sources.title: Happy Go Lovely 1951 David Niven
sources.description: The chauffeur (Hugh Dempster) for the richest man in Scotland, greeting card manufacturer B.G. Bruno (David Niven), drops by an Edinburgh theater to return the lost purse of chorus girl Janet Jones (Vera-Ellen). Financially strapped producer Jack Frost (Cesar Romero) plucks the girl out of obscurity to become his new female lead, sure that she must be Bruno's secret girlfriend. On a whim, Bruno impersonates a visiting reporter to find out more about the new star.

sources.title: Happy Go Lovely 1951 202401
sources.description: B.G. Bruno, a rich bachelor, the head of a successful greeting-card company in Scotland, is essentially a kind man but respectable to the point of stodginess and extreme stuffiness. An American troupe visiting Edinburgh wants to produce a musical in town but has trouble getting backers. Bruno meets several of the leading ladies of the show; through a misunderstanding he doesn't correct they think that he's a newspaper reporter. He falls in love with one of the women, who reciprocates; he grows more lively and friendly, to the surprise of his employees. After a series of mishaps and comic incidents comes a happy ending: a successful show and true love. Watch on RetroFlix:  https://retroflix.org/happy-go-lovely-1951/

sources.title: Happy Go Lovely (1951) DAVID NIVEN
sources.description:
Stars: David Niven, Vera-Ellen, Cesar Romero
Director: H. Bruce Humberstone

When chauffeur for B.G Bruno, the richest man in Scotland, drops by a theater to return the purse of a chorus girl, the financially strapped producer plucks the girl out of obscurity to become his new female lead, sure that she must be Bruno's secret girlfriend.

sources.title: Happy Go Lovely (1951) Musical, Romance | with David Niven, Vera-Ellen, Cesar Romero
sources.description:
An American troupe visiting Edinburgh wants to produce a musical in town but has trouble getting backers. The cash-strapped theater director John, thinks that his chorus girl Janet, is B.G. Bruno's girlfriend and makes her the lead. She meets Bruno, thinking he's a reporter not a millionaire mogul. More confusion follows. Eventually, amidst comedic mishaps, the musical becomes a success and Bruno finds true love.

Original title: Happy Go Lovely (1951)
This film is subtitled in many language options.

Alternative titles: Glücklich und verliebt, Horas de ensueño, L'amore è bello, O Mundo a Seus Pés, Härligt förälskad

Director: H. Bruce Humberstone
Writers: Val Guest, Friedrich Dammann, Herbert Rosenfeld
Main Cast: 
David Niven as B.G. Bruno 
Vera-Ellen as Janet Jones
Cesar Romero as John Frost
Bobby Howes as Charlie
Diane Hart as Mae
Genres: Comedy, Musical, Romance


00:00 - Full Movie (with subtitles)
00:04 - A comedic musical kicks off in Edinburgh, facing financial and artistic hurdles during the festival.
10:07 - Backstage chaos erupts as the stage manager grapples with challenges during musical rehearsals.
17:00 - A mix-up with a bag leads to Janet Jones potentially landing a starring role in the show.
22:27 - Mistaken identity creates comedic confusion as a young woman receives lavish gifts and opportunities.
29:07 - Mr. Bruno’s accidental link to a theater star sparks humorous chaos and misunderstandings.
41:12 - An interview between Janet Jones and Paul Tracy uncovers unexpected connections and confusions.
46:23 - A charming musical romance unfolds as a chorus girl becomes a star while navigating love and ambition.
51:44 - Backstage drama ensues as a young woman navigates the complexities of the entertainment industry.
57:49 - A scheme is hatched for a man to pose as a wealthy millionaire to save a failing show.
1:01:50 - Paul, disguised as a millionaire, struggles to maintain his cover while dining with Mr. Frost.
1:08:16 - Paul considers investing in a theater show after a pivotal encounter with B.G. Bruno at a party.
1:13:27 - A man impersonating a millionaire sparks comedic chaos and confusion throughout the production.
1:27:25 - Mistaken identities and lost checks lead to uproarious mayhem during a theatrical performance.

metadata.Plot: B.G. Bruno, a rich bachelor, the head of a successful greeting-card company in Scotland, is essentially a kind man but respectable to the point of stodginess and extreme stuffiness. An American troupe visiting Edinburgh wants to produce a musical in town but has trouble getting backers. Bruno meets several of the leading ladies of the show; through a misunderstanding he doesn't correct the idea that he's a newspaper reporter. He falls in love with one of the women, who reciprocates; he grows more lively and friendly, to the surprise of his employees. After a series of mishaps and comic incidents comes a happy ending: a successful show and true love.
